result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott D Wimer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration And the Substance Abuse Programs.
AMENDED 2/17/2016:  COURT GRANTS 95 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT.  DEFENDANT IS ELIGIBLE FOR THE SUBSTANCE ABUSE PROGRAM.

AMENDED 12/21/2017:  COURT GRANTS 246 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution in the amount of $1525 to be paid to New Berlin Pharmacy as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

DNA Sample and Surcharge are WAIVED.

Costs to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Follow through with Mental Health Care.

No contact with New Berlin Pharmacy or R.S.
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.
DNA Sample WAIED. Surcharge WAIVED.

Certificate of Achievement

Defendant Scott D Wimer in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recommendations by the State.  Statements by S.W. and P.S.  Arguments by the defense.  Statement by defendant.

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 16 years (Initial Confinement: 10 years, Extended Supervision: 6 years) 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- Restitution in the amount of $1525.00 to be paid to New Berlin Pharmacy as a Condition of Extended Supervision.  
- DNA Surcharge waived 
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  No contact with New Berlin Pharmacy or R.S.  Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.  Follow through with Mental Health care.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.
Sentencing hearing on March 12, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Scott D Wimer in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
